data.text: @robertrea @gsoh31 Been in the same boat. And yes, it is different. But not as different so as to still merit the stupendous hype which it deserved at the start. We have to move on. There's a limit to how much we restrict ourselves over a new version of the flu which we are anyway powerless to stop

@gsoh31 It's fine...

It's endemic now, not pandemic...

So basically, last week you were allowed to be respected for dying, but this week, shut the f....

I can't confirm that's the official line, but as SAGE has been abandoned, neither can they.

@philwoodford @gsoh31 @RKakati The Government already had a problem with waning of vaccine effectiveness and slowness of booster rollout late last summer, just dealt with it in the nick of time for Omicron. Why can't they even learn from their own mistakes?
@philwoodford @gsoh31 @RKakati Wonder if new covid cases more than second/third time covid catchers … (me not had it yet, assume I will sometime).
@philwoodford @gsoh31 @RKakati End of restrictions. Sadly only to be expected. And with events elsewhere dominating the headlines the 'it's all over' feeling will persist. Maybe until it's too late
@gsoh31 @RKakati I am guessing we may be seeing boosters waning, but I suppose oldsters are going to get another fairly soon. It’s all a bit depressing.

@StamfordHillie @gsoh31 Oh it is different. It’s far more infectious than flu and causes more serious illness than both. One of my friends went into a coma as a result of Covid. Please don’t spout nonsense
@gsoh31 Was always going to happen people who don't receive company sick pay will just go to work rather than try survive on statutory sick pay

@robertrea @gsoh31 Just as we live with cold and flu. This isn't any different. The hyped up Covid religion infused many people with a sense of purpose, something they never had, but they now need to get real and find a real sense of purpose, something truly meaningful.
@StamfordHillie @gsoh31 We e been living with it for 2 years. The question is not whether we live with it, it’s how we live with it
